intro: Conostegia quadrangularis, commonly known as the four-angle balsa, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, quadrangular stems. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Conostegia quadrangularis is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in humid climates.
